seed_review: I don't know how we haven't got bugs from some of these! As here this would have had a stale `value`

• The dependency array for the useEffect hook has been modified to include both 'setValues' and 'value', which will trigger the effect when either of these dependencies change. This could lead to more frequent updates, potentially impacting performance if the effect is resource-intensive.

• Without a default value for 'value', this could lead to unexpected behavior or errors when the effect is triggered.

best_review:

• This change prevents potential errors or unexpected behavior in subsequent code that relies on frame dimensions, potentially affecting layout or positioning.
• The use of `let` in lines 32-33 is available in ES6 (with `esversion: 6`) or Mozilla JS extensions (with `moz`).

seed_review: I'm not sure what the value of this is. So far we've solved this by always doing `tagName.toUpperCase()` for everything. I think we should stick with this.
best_review:
• The added `axe.utils.getTagName` function seems unnecessary, as it duplicates the existing behavior of using `tagName.toUpperCase()` for all cases. 
• The conditionally returning lowercased tag name only applies to XHTML namespaceURI, which is a specific edge case that may not be relevant in most scenarios.
• The function's logic could be simplified by removing the namespaceURI check and always returning the lowercased tagName, as this is the behavior currently implemented in `tagName.toUpperCase()`.

seed_review: Why the `/-/verdaccio/` ?

• The logic for sending the logo file now sends 'logo.png' from '/-/static' if 'web.logo' is not found, whereas previously it sent 'logo-sm.png' from 'static'.
• The change in route and logic may require updates to other parts of the app that rely on the original '/-/logo' route.

seed_review: Mmm .... this affect #168 I'll need to research the collateral damage
best_review:
• The value of the 'notBefore' option in the 'jwt.sign' function has been changed from '1000' to '1', which reduces the time before which the JWT MUST NOT be accepted for processing by 999 seconds, allowing for more time to process the JWT.
• This change may have unintended consequences on the authentication process, potentially enabling JWTs to be processed 999 seconds after the specified 'notBefore' time.
• The reduced value of 'notBefore' could lead to a larger window of vulnerability where invalid or tampered JWTs might be accepted for processing.

seed_review: From the code, a check's metatdata was only added to `axe._load` if a rule used it. Since `role-none` and `role-presentation` were no longer used in any rule, their metadata was never added. This caused any translation file that passed translations for those checks to fail `axe.configure` with > "Locale provided for unknown check: "role-none"" To fix I added this line to parse all checks regardless of if a rule uses it or not.

• This change may affect rules and checks variables if `parseChecks` has side effects, potentially impacting other code relying on these variables.
